name: South Beach DIY
description: Gritty DIY spot under the expressway overpass. Raw concrete and creative obstacles built by locals.
history: Built organically by Staten Island skaters who needed a covered spot for rainy days. Constantly evolving.
bestTimes: Works in rain thanks to overhead cover. Best on weekday evenings.
transitDirections: S51 bus to Father Capodanno Blvd, walk under the overpass.

detailedNotes.terrain: Features include DIY quarter pipe, bank-to-wall, jersey barriers, flat bars. Raw concrete and found materials — expect imperfections.
detailedNotes.culture: Part of the Staten Island skate scene in South Beach. Built organically by Staten Island skaters who needed a covered spot for rainy days. Constantly evolving.
detailedNotes.tips: Best approach: S51 bus to Father Capodanno Blvd, walk under the overpass.. Works in rain thanks to overhead cover. Best on weekday evenings.
detailedNotes.warnings: DIY spot — skate at your own risk, terrain changes frequently.
